11:"$Sreact.suspense"
2:Tc76,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Recipe","name":"Medialunas","description":"Argentina's beloved breakfast pastry — a buttery, slightly sweet crescent that's smaller and sweeter than a French croissant. Enjoyed with café con leche at every corner cafe in Buenos Aires.","image":"https://expatsargentina.com/images/recipes/medialunas.webp","author":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Expats Argentina"},"datePublished":"2025-01-01","prepTime":"PT2M","cookTime":"PT20M","totalTime":"PT22M","recipeYield":"24 servings","recipeCategory":"dessert","recipeCuisine":"Argentine","keywords":"medialunas recipe, argentine croissant, medialunas de manteca, buenos aires breakfast, argentine pastry recipe","nutrition":{"@type":"NutritionInformation","calories":"180 calories","proteinContent":"4g","carbohydrateContent":"22g","fatContent":"9g"},"recipeIngredient":["Dough: 500g (4 cups) all-purpose flour","Dough: 60g (1/4 cup) sugar","Dough: 10g (1.5 tsp) salt","Dough: 15g (2 packets) active dry yeast","Dough: 200ml (3/4 cup + 2 tbsp) warm milk","Dough: 2 eggs","Dough: 50g (3.5 tbsp) softened butter","Butter block: 250g (1 cup + 2 tbsp) cold butter, shaped into a flat rectangle","Syrup glaze: 200g (1 cup) sugar","Syrup glaze: 100ml (1/3 cup + 1 tbsp) water","Syrup glaze: 1 tsp vanilla extract"],"recipeInstructions":[{"@type":"HowToStep","position":1,"text":"Dissolve yeast in warm milk with a pinch of sugar. Let sit 10 minutes until foamy."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":2,"text":"In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, and salt. Add yeast mixture, eggs, and softened butter."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":3,"text":"Knead for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic. The dough should be slightly tacky."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":4,"text":"Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":5,"text":"Roll the cold dough into a large rectangle. Place the butter block in the center."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":6,"text":"Fold the dough over the butter (like a letter), enclosing it completely."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":7,"text":"Roll out and fold in thirds. Wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes. Repeat this 2 more times."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":8,"text":"After the final fold and rest, roll the dough to 5mm (1/4 inch) thickness."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":9,"text":"Cut into triangles (base about 10cm/4 inches wide)."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":10,"text":"Roll each triangle from base to tip, curving the ends into a crescent shape."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":11,"text":"Place on lined baking sheets, cover, and let rise 1-2 hours until doubled."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":12,"text":"Brush with egg wash (1 egg beaten with 1 tbsp milk)."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":13,"text":"Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 15-18 minutes until deep golden."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":14,"text":"While baking, make the syrup: boil sugar and water until slightly thickened, add vanilla."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":15,"text":"Brush hot medialunas generously with the sugar syrup immediately after baking."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":16,"text":"Let cool slightly before serving — they're best warm."}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-b from-orange-50 to-white","children":[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],"$L3","$L4","$L5","$L6"]}],null,"$L7"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}
3:["$","div",null,{"className":"border-b bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-sm sticky top-0 z-40 print:hidden","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-5xl mx-auto px-4 py-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center justify-between","children":["$","$L8",null,{"href":"/food/recipes","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-arrow-left w-4 h-4","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1l729n",{"d":"m12 19-7-7 7-7"}],["$","path","x3x0zl",{"d":"M19 12H5"}],"$undefined"]}],"All Recipes"],"data-slot":"button","data-variant":"ghost","data-size":"sm","className":"inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap text-sm font-medium transition-all disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 [&_svg]:pointer-events-none [&_svg:not([class*='size-'])]:size-4 shrink-0 [&_svg]:shrink-0 outline-none focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground dark:hover:bg-accent/50 h-8 rounded-md px-3 has-[>svg]:px-2.5 gap-2","ref":null}]}]}]}]

put everything back in the fridge."}]]}],["$","li","1",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"The sugar syrup glaze is what makes medialunas different from croissants — don't skip it."}]]}],["$","li","2",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Real panaderías use a mix of butter and lard ('de grasa') for a more traditional mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Don't over-proof — they should be puffy but not fragile, or they'll collapse in the mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Eat with café con leche for the authentic Argentine breakfast experience."}]]}]]}]}]]}]
1d:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"history","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-history w-5 h-5 text-orange-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1357e3",{"d":"M3 12a9 9 0 1 0 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 0-6.74 2.74L3 8"}],["$","path","1xhq8a",{"d":"M3 3v5h5"}],["$","path","1fdv2h",{"d":"M12 7v5l4 2"}],"$undefined"]}],"The Story Behind the Dish"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed","children":"Medialunas (literally 'half moons') arrived in Argentina with Italian and French immigrants in the late 19th century. They evolved into something distinctly Argentine — smaller, sweeter, and glossier than French croissants, with a signature sugar syrup glaze. There are two types: 'de manteca' (butter, the premium version) and 'de grasa' (lard, more traditional). Every corner panadería makes them fresh daily, and no Argentine breakfast is complete without them alongside café con leche."}]}]]}]
1e:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6 pb-3","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold text-lg","children":"Storage & Leftovers"}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-0","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Best eaten the day they're made. Freeze unbaked medialunas for up to 1 month — thaw overnight and bake fresh. Day-old medialunas can be refreshed in a 350°F oven for 5 minutes."}]}]]}]
